info.description: Specification of endpoints defined in the Simple Bank Account Origination experimental standard.  This is an experimental standard created by the Data Standards Body (DSB) as part of the Consumer Data Standards
info.title: CDR Experimantal Simple Bank Account Origination API

get.description: Obtain the meta data describing how to make an application for a family of products.

parameters.name: schemeId
parameters.description: Obtain the details of a specific origination scheme.

400.description:
The following error codes MUST be supported:
  • [400 - Invalid Field](#error-400-field-invalid)
  • [400 - Missing Field](#error-400-field-missing)
  • [400 - Invalid Page Size](#error-400-field-invalid-page-size)
  • [400 - Invalid Version](#error-400-header-invalid-version)

406.description:
The following error codes MUST be supported:
  • [406 - Unsupported Version](#error-406-header-unsupported-version)

422.description:
The following error codes MUST be supported:
  • [422 - Invalid Page](#error-422-field-invalid-page)

post.description: Submit an application, on behalf of a consumer, to apply for an account to be originated.

requestBody.description: Application data provided in accordance to a defined origination scheme

400.description:
The following error codes MUST be supported:
  • [400 - Invalid Field](#error-400-field-invalid)
  • [400 - Missing Field](#error-400-field-missing)
  • [400 - Invalid Page Size](#error-400-field-invalid-page-size)
  • [400 - Invalid Version](#error-400-header-invalid-version)

406.description:
The following error codes MUST be supported:
  • [406 - Unsupported Version](#error-406-header-unsupported-version)

422.description:
The following error codes MUST be supported:
  • [422 - Invalid Page](#error-422-field-invalid-page)

schema.description: The [version](#response-headers) of the API end point that the data holder has responded with.

x-v.name: x-v
x-v.description: Version of the API end point requested by the client. Must be set to a positive integer. The data holder should respond with the highest supported version between [x-min-v](#request-headers) and [x-v](#request-headers). If the value of [x-min-v](#request-headers) is equal to or higher than the value of [x-v](#request-headers) then the [x-min-v](#request-headers) header should be treated as absent. If all versions requested are not supported then the data holder must respond with a 406 Not Acceptable. See [HTTP Headers](#request-headers)

x-min-v.name: x-min-v
x-min-v.description: Minimum version of the API end point requested by the client. Must be set to a positive integer if provided. The data holder should respond with the highest supported version between [x-min-v](#request-headers) and [x-v](#request-headers). If all versions requested are not supported then the data holder must respond with a 406 Not Acceptable.

cdrAccounts.description: Array of summary account data for an applicant obtained from the CDR

cdrAccountDetails.description: Array of detailed account data for an applicant obtained from the CDR

cdrBalances.description: Array of account balance data for an applicant obtained from the CDR

cdrTransactions.description: Array of transaction data for an applicant obtained from the CDR

cdrCustomerDetails.description: Array of customer detail data for an applicant obtained from the CDR

schemeUType.description: The type of origination scheme represented

nextStep.description: The next step that will be taken for this applicagtion

rejectionReasons.description: Array of reasons that the application was rejected that need to be rectified before the application will be accepted

redirectUri.description: A web page that the customer should be directed to so that the application can be continued

applicantMessage.description: An optional message that can be displayed to the applicant to describe the next steps

code.description: The code of the error encountered. Where the error is specific to the respondent, an application-specific error code, expressed as a string value. If the error is application-specific, the URN code that the specific error extends must be provided in the meta object. Otherwise, the value is the error code URN.

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem that MUST NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem represented by the error code.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.

LixiOriginationSchemeModelV1.description: Provides the metadata for making an application using a LIXI gateway. Mandatory if schemeUType is set to 'lixi'

submissionUri.description: Base path used to access the LIXI gateway

schemaUri.description: Location of file describing the supported LIXI schema.  Must be a file ending in .xsd (representing an XSD file) or .json (representing a JSON Schema file)

lixiCode.description: The LIXI participant code, assigned by LIXI, for the receiving organisation

lixiVersion.description: The supported version of the LIXI schema

lixiCustomVersion.description: Optional identifier of a custom version of the LIXI payloads that are accepted if the receiving organisation has made custom extensions or modifications to the LIXI schema

productCodeMappings.description: Optional mapping of CDR product IDs to product codes used in LIXI applications via this origination scheme.  If absent, or if a mapping is not included, then the CDR product ID is expected to be used as the LIXI product code

productId.description: The CDR product ID to map from

productCode.description: The LIXI product code to map to

schematronUri.description: Optional reference to a Schematron file indicating the valid use of this LIXI gateway

apiSpecificationUri.description: Optional reference to an Open API Specification file describing the submission API

additionalInfoUri.description: Optional reference to a web page with additional documention describing the use of the LIXI gateway

CdrOriginationSchemeModelV1.description: Provides the metadata for making an application using version 1 of the CDR 'Apply For Bank Account' endpoint. Mandatory if schemeUType is set to 'cdrApplyForBankAccountV1'

version.descroiption: The highest version of the `Apply For Bank Account` endpoint currently supported

minVersion.description: The lowest version of the `Apply For Bank Account` endpoint currently supported if different from `version`

dataRequirements.description: The data objects supported by the `Apply For Bank Account` that are expected to be populated for this origination scheme, specified according to endpoint version.  An entry for each version between `version` and `minVersion` (inclusive) is expected to be included

v1.description: Data requirements when calling v1 of the `Apply For Bank Account` endpoint

requirement.description:
Indicate whether the specific data set or field is required or not for the application.  Valid options are:
* REQUIRED - This data set is required for an application to be accepted
* PREFERRED - This data is needed for completion of the origination process but an application will be accepted without it
* OPTIONAL - This data can be accepted but and will assist in the origination process
* NOT_SUPPORTED - This data should not be sent as it will not be used

TermsModelV1.description: One or more statements that the customer must agree to for the origination process to be completed

displayName.description: The display name of the terms to be presented to the customer

termId.description: Unique identifier of the terms to be used to report acceptance

uri.description: Path to the contact for the terms and conditions to present to the customer

mimeType.description: Mime type that the terms will be provided in so that the client can determine how best to display the content to the customer

RejectionReasonModelV1.description: A single reason given to explain the rejection of an application

detail.description: Additional information that is reason type dependent that gives more detail

mimeType.description: Mime type that the terms will be provided in so that the client can determine how best to display the content to the customer

agent.description: Details of the specific agent providing the application

phoneNumber.description: Contact phone number for the referring agent

email.description: Contact email address of the referring agent

acl.description: The Australian Credit License number of the referrer

afsl.description: The Australian Financial Services License number of the referrer

holderSpecificDetails.description: Identifying details specific to, and known by, the data holder receiving the application

assertions.description: Assertions of compliance steps already undertaken

confirmNeedsAnalysisConducted.description: Assertion that the referrer has, or has not, conducted appropriate nedds analysis

confirmTargetMarketAssessed.description: Assertion that the referrer has, or has not, determined that the applicants are included in the target market determinations for the products being applied for

confirmTerms.description: Confirm that terms and conditions have been shown to, and have been approved by, the primary applicant

confirmed.description: Assertion that the terms and conditions have been shown to, and have been approved by, the primary applicant

termId.description: The specific ID of the terms that have been approved by the applicant (obtained from the origination scheme)

ApplicantsModelV1.description: The primary applicant for this application

secondary.description: Array of one or more secondary applicants

applicantId.description: The ID of this applicant.  This ID must be uniuqe in the context of this application but does not need to be globally unique

IndividualApplicantModelV1.description: A single applicant who is an individual

phone.description: Contact phone number of the applicant

tfn.description: Tax file number of the applicant

otherCountries.description: Array of other countries where the applicant is registered for tax

items.description: The tax registration in a country other than Australia

country.description: Country of tax regisration defined using three character ISO country code

tin.description: Tax identification number for the registration

reasonForNoTin.description: Reason for no TIN, if none is provided

proof.description: Forms of identity proofs provided by the applicant

auDriversLicense.description: Details of an Australian drivers license

stateOfIssue.description: Australian state that the license was issued by

referenceNumber.description: Reference number next to the name of the applicant

documentNumber.description: The identifying number of the passport

expiryDate.description: Date of expiry in RFC3339 full-date format

documentNumber.description: The identifying number of the passport

country.description: Country of issue in 3 character ISO format

visa.description: Details of a visa for entering Australia

trn.description: The transaction reference number for the Visa

evidenceNumber.description: The evidence number for the Visa

grantNumber.description: The grant number for the Visa

ProductsModelV1.description: The details of the products being applied for

items.description: The details of a single product being applied for

productId.description: The ID of the product being applied for as defined in the bank PRD endpoints

homeLoan.description: Additional details if the product is a home loan

loanPurpose.description: The reason for taking out the loan

term.description: The length of the loan in months

amount.description: The amount requested for the loan in AUD

propertyValue.description: The estimated value of the property to be purchased in AUD

propertyAddress.description: The address of the property to be purchased, if known

termDeposit.description: Additional details if the product is a term deposit

term.description: The length of time for the term deposit to be established in months

amount.description: The amount of savings in AUD

personalLoan.description: Additional details if the product is a personal loan

loanPurpose.description: The reason for taking out the loan

term.description: The length of the loan in months

amount.description: The amount requested for the loan in AUD

creditCard.description: Additional details if the product is a credit card

balanceTransfer.description: The estimated balance, in AUD, to be transferred to the new card once established

IncomeModelV1.description: Array of income for one or more applicants

applicantIds.description: The IDs of the applicants that these income items are associated with

income.description: The income associated with the specified applicants

estimatedValue.description: Estimated value of the income in AUD

ExpensesModelV1.description: Array of expenses for one or more applicants

applicantIds.description: The IDs of the applicants that these expenses are associated with

expenses.description: The expenses associated with the specified applicants

estimatedValue.description: Estimated value of the expense in AUD

AssetsModelV1.description: Array of assets for one or more applicants

applicantIds.description: The IDs of the applicants that these assets are associated with

assets.description: The assets associated with the specified applicants

properties.description: Array of properties in this asset set

estimatedValue.description: Estimated value of the property in AUD

valueHeldHere.description: Cash savings held with the bank the application is being submitted to

estimatedValue.description: Cash savings held with other banks
Estimated value of the asset in AUD

LiabilitiesModelV1.description: Array of liabilities for one or more applicants

applicantIds.description: The IDs of the applicants that these liabilities are associated with

liabilities.description: The liabilities associated with the specified applicants

balanceHere.description: Liability balance with the bank the application is being submitted to

balanceElsewhere.description: Liability balance held with other banks

balanceHere.description: Liability balance with the bank the application is being submitted to

balanceElsewhere.description: Liability balance held with other banks

balanceHere.description: Liability balance with the bank the application is being submitted to

balanceElsewhere.description: Liability balance held with other banks

linesOfCredit.description: Overdraft or lines of credit balances

balanceHere.description: Liability balance with the bank the application is being submitted to

balanceElsewhere.description: Liability balance held with other banks

balanceHere.description: Liability balance with the bank the application is being submitted to

balanceElsewhere.description: Liability balance held with other banks

PeriodModelV1.description: The period for income or expense

applicantId.description: ID of the applicant in the applicants array that this data relates to

v.description: The x-v value of the response payload obtained via the CDR

dataHolderBrandId.description: The data holder brand ID on the CDR Register for the data holder the data was obtained from

data.description: The actual data obtained via the CDR

self.description: Fully qualified link that generated the current response document
Fully qualified link that generated the current response document

first.description: URI to the first page of this set. Mandatory if this response is not the first page

prev.description: URI to the previous page of this set. Mandatory if this response is not the first page

next.description: URI to the next page of this set. Mandatory if this response is not the last page

last.description: URI to the last page of this set. Mandatory if this response is not the last page

totalRecords.description: The total number of records in the full set. See [pagination](#pagination).

totalPages.description: The total number of pages in the full set. See [pagination](#pagination).

urn.description: The CDR error code URN which the application-specific error code extends. Mandatory if the error `code` is an application-specific error rather than a standardised error code.

MetaError.description: Additional data for customised error codes
